none: Initial T with Jeronymite Monks at the Dedication of an Altar – NGA 1964.8.1219
Initial T with Jeronymite Monks at the Dedication of an Altar

Initial T formed with heads and bodies of dragons, with the head of a bearded man, enclosing a historiated scene with Observant Jeronymite friars singing from a choir book at an altar with a lion-headed spout at the base from which water flows into a ravine at which a bearded and kneeling prophet figure washes.
Monastery of San Isidoro del Campo
Initial T with Jeronymite Monks at the Dedication of an Altar

body.value: Depiction of a gilded altarpiece with Saint Paul (left, in red) and Saint Peter (right, in blue) holding representations of liturgical texts.
Metapictorial choir book with musical notation for the chant Terribilis est locus iste (Cantus ID 007763) at right, the original liturgical context for this initial ‘T’.
A brown-robed Observant Jeronymite friar prays over an altar covered with a white cloth.

seo.title: Initial T with Jeronymite Monks at the Dedication of an Altar – NGA 1964.8.1219 - Illuminated Choir Books of San Isidoro del Campo
